verses.text: Wisdom lifts up the humble; the poor of spirit are given honor.
verses.comment: This opening emphasizes the value of humility, echoed in both Old and New Testament teachings (cf. Matthew 5:3).

verses.text: Do not praise someone for their appearance, nor despise anyone for their outward form.
verses.comment: This verse teaches discernment and cautions against outward judgments (cf. 1 Sam. 16:7).

verses.text: The bee is small among winged creatures, but her produce is the sweetest of all.
verses.comment: God can use the humble for great purposes—a recurring theme throughout Scripture.

verses.text: Do not boast about clothing or honor yourself in times of glory, for the Lord's works are marvelous and hidden from men.
verses.comment: Divine providence often operates quietly and unexpectedly.

verses.text: Many kings have sat in the dust, while the humble have been crowned.
verses.comment: Illustrates the reversal of fortunes—a key motif, reflected in Mary's Magnificat (cf. Luke 1:52).

verses.text: Many powerful men have been utterly disgraced; and the gentle have found favor.
verses.comment: Echoes Jesus’ teaching that whoever humbles himself will be exalted.

verses.text: Do not blame before you have examined; first understand, then speak.
verses.comment: A call to patience and justice in judgment—a virtue praised in Christian tradition.

verses.text: Listen before answering, and do not interrupt someone in their speech.
verses.comment: Promotes prudence and humility in conversations.

verses.text: Do not be quick to argue before the assembly; do not repeat words in the midst of wise men.
verses.comment: Wisdom favors restraint and careful speech.

verses.text: Do not strive in matters that do not concern you, nor sit in judgment with sinners.
verses.comment: Intruding in others’ affairs can lead to trouble.

verses.text: My son, do not busy yourself with too many pursuits; if you multiply activities, you will not go unpunished.
verses.comment: Warns against distraction and overwork; reminds of the need for spiritual balance.

verses.text: There is one who toils, labors, rushes, and falls short, and grows poorer.
verses.comment: Material success alone does not assure security.

verses.text: Another who is weak and too slow in business, yet has the favor of God and is lifted up.
verses.comment: Suggests divine providence sometimes blesses those overlooked by the world.

verses.text: Prosperity and adversity, life and death, poverty and wealth, all come from the Lord.
verses.comment: God is sovereign over all circumstances—a key biblical doctrine.

verses.text: Wisdom, knowledge, and understanding of the law are from the Lord; love and good works come from him.
verses.comment: Highlights the necessity of divine grace for true wisdom and virtue—a point highly valued in Christian doctrine.

verses.text: Error and darkness were made for sinners; those who revel in evil age in wickedness.
verses.comment: Contrast between the destiny of the righteous and the sinner; see John 3:19.

verses.text: The gifts of the Lord remain with the devout, and his approval endures forever.
verses.comment: Stresses the eternal value of seeking God's favor and living in devotion.

verses.text: There is one who grows rich by being careful and stingy, and this is a reward he receives:
verses.comment: Warns of short-lived material gain.

verses.text: He says, 'Now I have found rest, now I will eat from my wealth,' but he does not know how long he will leave it and die.
verses.comment: Echoes Jesus’ parable of the rich fool (Luke 12:19–20), warning against putting trust in wealth.

verses.text: Keep steadfast to your mission, attend it seriously, and grow old in your work.
verses.comment: Commends diligence and faithfulness in one’s calling.

verses.text: Do not marvel at the works of sinners; trust in the Lord and stay in your labor.
verses.comment: Exhorts perseverance and faith, even when the wicked prosper.

verses.text: It is easy for the Lord, at the hour of death, to repay a person as he deserves.
verses.comment: God’s judgment is just and sure, sometimes sudden.

verses.text: The troubles of a moment bring joy; blessings quickly come from the Lord for the upright.
verses.comment: Affirmation that suffering can be brief and followed by divine blessing.

verses.text: In the hour of tribulation, the good deeds of a person may be forgotten; in the hour of joy, their evil is not remembered.
verses.comment: This points to God’s mercy and the forgiveness of sins.

verses.text: Judge no one before their time; for each is known by their end.
verses.comment: Encourages patience and leaving final judgment to God—a theme in Christian eschatology.

verses.text: How easy it is for the Lord to make a poor person rich, or suddenly to humble the mighty.
verses.comment: Affirms God’s sovereignty over human destiny.

verses.text: The blessing of the Lord is in the reward of the godly; he quickly makes his blessing flourish.
verses.comment: God’s favor manifests in spiritual and sometimes material abundance.

verses.text: Say not: What is the purpose of my life? What will come after me? Do not worry over what is hidden.
verses.comment: Counsels trust in God regarding the future—a recurring biblical principle.

verses.text: Do not waste your strength on useless pursuits, nor wander in the desert of destruction.
verses.comment: Warning against the futility of idleness or fruitless ambition.

verses.text: Do not plant yourself among foolish people; remember, wrath can destroy even the wise.
verses.comment: Associations matter for spiritual growth; the wise must guard their soul vigilantly.

verses.text: Do not humble yourself before a fool, nor give preference to the ungodly.
verses.comment: Ensures dignity is kept in all relationships, warning against misplaced honor.

verses.text: Guard yourself from evil, prepare yourself against temptation, so you do not fall.
verses.comment: Vigilance against sin is necessary for perseverance—a foundational teaching in Christian spirituality.

verses.text: One who touches tar will be stained; one who keeps company with arrogant people will become like them.
verses.comment: Warns of the corrosive effects of sinful company and pride.

verses.text: Do not invite a stranger into your house; their heart may be plotting against you and turn your life into chaos.
verses.comment: A practical warning, pressing for prudence and discernment even in acts of kindness.
